meanings.definition: Having the same relative position, value, or structure
meanings.sent1: The two homologic shapes fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent2: The homologic buildings in the town were identical in size and shape.
meanings.sent3: The homologic puzzle pieces were so similar that they could be easily confused.
meanings.sent4: Their homologic relationship was like two peas in a pod.
meanings.sent5: The homologic patterns on the fabric made it easy to match them up.

meanings.definition: Corresponding in structure and position but not necessarily in function
meanings.sent1: The homologic tools looked alike but served different purposes.
meanings.sent2: The homologic keys opened different doors in the building.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the homologic gadgets being used for opposite tasks.
meanings.sent4: Their homologic appearance masked their distinct functions.
meanings.sent5: The homologic twins had similar features but different personalities.

meanings.definition: Relating to homology or homologous structures
meanings.sent1: The homologic genes shared common ancestry.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the homologic structures in different species.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to imagine homologic animals swapping places in the wild.
meanings.sent4: The homologic relationship between the two species was fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The homologic traits were passed down through generations.
